intro: Miconia josecuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Mexican miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant is typically found in humid, lowland tropical forests, where it thrives in shaded environments. Its botanical features include a woody stem and the presence of stellate hairs on its leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
